patterns: List the categories in the competition
responses: The categories are: Dan/poom, K3, K2, K1, and Family.
Categories include Dan/poom, K3, K2, K1, and Family.

patterns: Explain the cut-off system for Dan
How does the cut-off system work for Dan?
What are the rules for Dan cut-off?
responses: For Dan, if there are more than 20 competitors, 50% advance to the semi-finals. If there are 20 or fewer competitors, the competition goes directly to semi-finals with the top 8 advancing to finals.

patterns: Explain the cut-off system for K1, K2, and K3
How does the cut-off system work for K1, K2, K3?
What are the rules for K1, K2, K3 cut-off?
responses: For K1, K2, and K3, if there are more than 12 competitors, the top 8 advance to the finals. If there are 12 or fewer competitors, the competition goes directly to finals.
Individual: 35 Euro per athlete
Pair: 40 Euro per pair
Team/Family: 40 Euro per team
Compulsory Poomsae Draw: Wednesday 29th of May, 20:00 pm CET
Registration Deadline: Friday 31st of May, 23:59 pm CET
Online Competition Date: Sunday 9th of June, 09:00 am CET
Competition will be held under World Taekwondo Poomsae rules.
The competition will run on a Cut Off System of up to 3 rounds for Dan/Poom categories.

patterns: What are the rules for the Family category?
Tell me about the Family category
responses: In the Family category, at least two generations must participate (e.g., parent and child). There is an unlimited number of competitors, and the competition goes directly to finals with two forms recorded as per the competitor's choice.

patterns: What are the rules for K3?
responses: For K3 (10th-7th kup): The form is the competitor’s choice, and forms can be repeated, even in the same round.

patterns: What are the rules for K2?
responses: For K2 (6th-3rd kup): The form is the competitor’s choice, but forms cannot be repeated. All forms in both rounds must be different.

patterns: What are the rules for K1?
responses: For K1 (2nd-1st kup): Competitors must perform compulsory forms.

patterns: Tell me about the deduction rules for the online championship
What are the rules for attire?

responses: For any inquiries, please contact Master Kambiz Ramzan Ali at +44 (0)7944988806 or rangesportsuk@gmail.com.
Pair poomsae categories include Cadet, Junior, Under 30, and Over 30 divisions.
Compulsory Poomsae includes Taegeuk 4,5,6,7,8 Jang, Koryo, and Keumgang.
Team poomsae categories include Cadet, Junior, Under 30, and Over 30 divisions.
Compulsory Poomsae includes Taegeuk 4,5,6,7,8 Jang, Koryo, and Keumgang.
Para poomsae categories include Visual Impairments, Intellectually Impaired, Physical Impairments, Limb Deficiency, Wheelchair Classes, Deaf, Short Stature.
Participants must follow the specified Poomsae rules for each category.
Family poomsae allows one parent, parents, or grandparents together with their child or children or grandchildren.
At least two generations are required for a family team.
